triples.name: Mobile robot
triples.relevance: Mobile robots are the primary focus of the survey, which addresses task and motion planning for multiple autonomous mobile systems.

triples.name: Motion planning
triples.relevance: Motion planning is a core component of the task and motion planning integration that the survey reviews.

triples.name: Automated planning and scheduling
triples.relevance: Automated planning is the task-level counterpart to motion planning, representing the high-level decision making in multi-robot systems.

triples.name: Swarm robotics
triples.relevance: Swarm robotics represents a major approach to multi-robot coordination and collaboration covered in the survey.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: Multi-agent systems provide the theoretical framework for coordinating multiple robots as interacting autonomous agents.

triples.name: Autonomous robot
triples.relevance: Autonomous robots are the fundamental subject of the survey, requiring combined task and motion planning capabilities.

triples.name: Artificial intelligence
triples.relevance: AI provides the foundational techniques and methodologies for task planning and decision-making in multi-robot systems.

triples.name: Real-time path planning
triples.relevance: Real-time path planning addresses the dynamic motion constraints required for practical multi-robot deployments.

triples.name: Probabilistic roadmap
triples.relevance: Probabilistic roadmaps are a key sampling-based motion planning algorithm used in multi-robot systems.

triples.name: Rapidly exploring random tree
triples.relevance: RRT algorithms are state-of-the-art sampling-based methods for high-dimensional motion planning in robotics.
